complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Update Credential System to Remove Company Domain Parameter
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the credential system update into: 1) Remove companyDomain property from credentials interface, 2) Update authenticate body configuration, 3) Test credential UI and backward compatibility with existing workflows
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Simple file modification with clear requirements. Involves updating TypeScript interfaces and configuration objects. Low complexity due to isolated changes in single file, but requires testing for backward compatibility.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Add Dynamic Node Parameters for Facebook URL and Company Domain
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand into: 1) Add node properties for facebook_url and company_domain with validation, 2) Implement mutual exclusivity logic, 3) Add n8n expression support, 4) Update routing configuration to use dynamic parameters, 5) Add comprehensive validation and error handling
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Medium-high complexity due to n8n-specific expression handling, mutual exclusivity logic, validation requirements, and integration with existing routing system. Requires understanding of n8n node property system.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down into: 1) Add webhook_url and continuation_token string parameters, 2) Implement media_type dropdown with validation, 3) Add country_code and active_status parameters, 4) Update routing body configuration to conditionally include parameters
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Medium complexity involving multiple parameter types, dropdown options, conditional logic, and proper TypeScript typing. Requires understanding of n8n parameter system and API integration patterns.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Implement Comprehensive Error Handling and Validation
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand into: 1) Add input validation for URLs and domains, 2) Implement API error handling (auth, network, rate limiting), 3) Create user-friendly error messages, 4) Add retry logic for transient failures, 5) Implement proper error propagation to n8n, 6) Add comprehensive error testing scenarios
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: High complexity due to need for robust error handling across multiple failure modes, retry mechanisms, user experience considerations, and n8n-specific error propagation patterns. Critical for production readiness.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Split into: 1) Verify current routing passes through raw API responses without transformation, 2) Update documentation and examples showing how to access response fields in downstream nodes
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Low complexity task mainly involving verification and documentation. The declarative routing in n8n typically passes through responses by default, so minimal code changes expected.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Add Pagination Support with Continuation Token
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down into: 1) Enhance node properties with continuation_token parameter and clear pagination documentation, 2) Add helper descriptions explaining pagination workflow, 3) Create example workflow demonstrating pagination loop pattern
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Medium complexity involving parameter enhancement and documentation. Requires understanding of n8n workflow patterns for pagination and clear user guidance for implementation.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Organize into: 1) Update package.json with correct author, repository, and description information, 2) Replace README.md with comprehensive Adyntel-specific documentation, 3) Update credentials documentationUrl to point to actual docs, 4) Create examples and troubleshooting sections
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Medium complexity requiring comprehensive documentation writing, metadata updates, and creation of practical examples. Involves understanding the integration thoroughly to write accurate documentation.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down into: 1) Set up Jest testing framework and configuration, 2) Create unit tests for parameter validation and error handling, 3) Implement integration tests with mock API responses, 4) Add end-to-end tests for actual API integration, 5) Set up test scripts in package.json, 6) Configure CI/CD pipeline integration, 7) Achieve high code coverage with comprehensive test scenarios
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: High complexity involving test framework setup, multiple testing layers (unit/integration/e2e), mock implementations, CI/CD integration, and comprehensive coverage. Requires deep understanding of n8n testing patterns and API behavior.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Optimize Build Pipeline and Asset Management
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Divide into: 1) Review and optimize TypeScript compilation settings, 2) Enhance Gulp configuration for improved asset copying and optimization, 3) Add build optimization for smaller bundle size, 4) Verify dist directory structure matches n8n requirements and test installation process
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Medium complexity involving build tooling optimization, asset management, and n8n-specific distribution requirements. Current gulpfile.js is basic and needs enhancement for production readiness.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Prepare for NPM Publication and Distribution
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Structure as: 1) Finalize package.json metadata and file inclusion settings, 2) Update LICENSE file and verify legal compliance, 3) Test npm pack and installation process thoroughly, 4) Prepare publication checklist and validate all requirements, 5) Test n8n discovery and integration after installation
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Medium-high complexity involving npm publishing workflows, legal compliance, comprehensive testing of installation process, and n8n-specific discovery mechanisms. Critical final step requiring attention to detail.
